Name: 100 Mile Table
Description:
100 Mile Table

Cafe, Catering & Events in Byron Bay

Come and visit our cafe at 8 Banksia Drive, Byron Bay Arts and Industrial Park. Monday to Friday, 7am-2pm.

Serving Marvell Street coffee, breakfast and lunch as well as a selection of our retail products.

100 Mile Table was born to create unique feasts and celebrations utilising the abundance of great local produce in whichever region of Australia we are cooking in. We have fast become known as one of the best event and wedding caterers in Byron Bay.

From the city to the bush, we will hunt out the very best the local area has to offer. We celebrate our love of food and provenance by sharing our knowledge and our table with you.

100 Mile Table lunches are held at regular intervals anywhere from the extraordinary Bangalow Guesthouse to a paddock, a barn or a private home.

We can create a feast to suit you and your celebration – an intimate cocktail or dinner party, Farm Table feasts or the luxury of a personalised hamper.

We can also help with your personal chefs needs, and enjoy taking the odd cooking class.

100 Mile Philosophy

“At 100 Mile Table, we practice a ‘locavore’ philosophy – one of respect for the source.”

Shopping locally maintains relationships with farmers and food producers – those who make it, bake it, sow it and grow it. We acknowledge the importance of food miles, the health, wellbeing and good treatment of animals and crops, so we shop and cook accordingly.
Short Description: From the city to the bush, we will hunt out the very best the local area has to offer. We celebrate our love of food and provenance by sharing our knowledge and our table with you.

Name: A Tavola
Description:
About A Tavola

The inspiration for A Tavola (meaning “to the table”) derives from head chef and owner Eugenio Maiale’s childhood. As a child Maiale would play in the backyard of his Adelaide home waiting to hear the chime of “A Tavola” when dinner was ready.

On Maiale’s family kitchen table were consistently simple, honest and traditional style dishes. It was a daily ritual, almost a meditation, for his Mother to maker her own pasta – from ravioli and tortellini to tagliolini. She passed her knowledge onto Eugenio who further developed these techniques during his childhood visits to Italy. He would watch his relatives make an assortment of pastas, including pappardelle and gnocchi, rolling the pasta on big wooden tables either by hand or with broom handles.

Maiale has continued this concept of simple and elegant food with his first Sydney restaurant. The cuisine can be described as predominantly “Abruzzese” (a region north-east of the boot, next to Rome), with a heavy emphasis on dried and fresh pasta cooked to order. His dream was to create a unique Italian experience. He has done this by creating what has been described as a “euro chic” dining space which revolves around a 10metre long communal Indian marble table.

Join the A Tavola family.

We are always looking for dedicated people to join our international team at A Tavola. Please note that all applicants must be eligible to work in Australia. Please write your application and resume in English.

Please submit your applications to Eugenio Maiale – employment@atavola.com.au
Short Description: Regional Italian dishes and housemade pasta served in a stylish space with a long communal table.

Name: Alice Springs Resort
Description:
Classic Comforts, Heartfelt Quality

Situated on the banks of the famous Todd River, Chifley Alice Springs Resort offers spectacular views of the towering River Red Gum, while the well-manicured lush green lawns of the Resort create a relaxing atmosphere as you soak in the Australian Outback charm of the Northern Territory (NT).

Centrally located just a few minutes’ walk away from the city’s thriving shopping, dining and entertainment venues, this award-winning Resort provides comfort with friendly service, the perfect base for travelers looking to hike the Larapinta Trail, to visit the Telegraph Station, Alice Springs Desert Park, School of the Air, Anzac Hill or take a day tour to Simpsons Gap or Rainbow Valley.

Alice Springs lies in the physical and spiritual heart of Australia’s Red Centre. It is surrounded on all sides by the jagged MacDonnell Ranges, which according to the traditional owners, the Arrernte people, was formed during the Dreamtime by giant caterpillars.

Australia’s classic outback drive, the Red Centre Way, from Uluru, Kings Canyon and Alice Springs, is one of the best ways to experience the natural wonders of this vast ancient red landscape.

With a focus on comfort, Chifley Alice Springs Resort offers a sophisticated “Outback” feel, true to the location, creating an unparalleled experience for our guests when they “Choose Chifley”.
Short Description: Centrally located just a few minutes’ walk away from the city’s thriving shopping, dining and entertainment venues, this award-winning Resort provides comfort with friendly service, the perfect base for travelers!

Description:

Name: Bells at Killcare
Description:
Join the team

We are always looking for enthusiastic and experienced staff to join our team. If you are interested in being a part of our 5-star hotel, please email us detailing which department you are experienced in.

About Bells

In 2006, Coast and Country Properties, purchased the Bells property from then owner, Ian Bell. Ian was inspired by Cape Lodge in Margaret River and Yarra Valley’s Chateau Yering Station, when he owned and operated the small bed & breakfast.

The manor house and 3 cottages sat amongst the stunning acreage of young gardens & presented a wonderful opportunity for further development that would enhance the existing property. Karina and Brian Barry, were then invited by Coast and Country Properties to manage the existing B&B and assess its potential.

Inspired by the beauty and potential of Bells, they had a vision to develop the B&B into a luxury world-class retreat. To achieve this goal, they leased the property and worked with Coast and Country to renovate and develop the property, in a way that would be sympathetic to the natural beauty of the area and to complement the existing cottages. In 2008, Stefano Manfredi and Julie Manfredi-Hughes were invited to come on board to assist with a new restaurant vision and redesign of the entire dining experience at the property.

The retreat has become one of the most recognisable and distinctive boutique hotels in Australia, with a fabulous reputation both in the industry and with guests.

Name: Bells Functions
Description:
Our Story

Bells Functions is situated on the upper deck of pier 3 Barrack Street Jetty and operates as an exclusive events space catering to weddings, birthday parties, engagement celebrations, private receptions and dinners.

Barrack Square was established in 1905-07 as part of a systematic program of reclamation to provide a fringe of parkland round the Swan River. The square is situated at the meeting point of Barrack Street and Riverside Drive. Four jetties were constructed from 1905-07, in 1973-78, these were rebuilt and a fifth jetty added. Buildings for the purpose of offices, ticketing and dining are sited on what is now know as the Barrack Street Jetty.
Short Description: Bells Functions is situated on the upper deck of pier 3 Barrack Street Jetty and operates as an exclusive events space catering to weddings, birthday parties, engagement celebrations, private receptions and dinners.

Name: Hallam's Restaurant
Description:
Hallam's is a popular choice for corporate groups, weddings and celebrations.

Opening the doors in January 1996 Hallam's has certainly made a name for itself through the years. This multi award winning Tasmanian eatery offers patrons with a delicious slate of local seafood options coupled with  breathtaking view's of the iconic Cataract Gorge and Tamar River. Catering to a wide range of dietary requirements, Hallam's chef's source only the highest quality sustainable seafood from the pristine waters around Tasmania such as; Blue Eye Trevalla, Flathead, Spring Bay Mussels, Oysters, Scallops and Crayfish to name a few. All of our seafood is sustainable and line caught allowing us to deliver only the best local produce to our guests. Glimpse a tasteful assortment of historic nautical-themed artefacts while sampling the freshest local produce the region has to offer. Hallam's will provide a unique culinary experience you won't soon forget.

Hallam's was given life by Stewart and Sally Hallam for the first 15 years, the restaurant is now owned by their son Salisbury Hallam. Taking over in 2011 Salisbury began infusing new life and vibrancy into the restaurant, offering an Asian influence and  fresh modern take on the routine seafood items you've come to know. The Hallam's crew present customers with an expertly-curated smattering innovative and accessible seafood options.

The Hallam's crew love developing lasting relationships with their repeat patrons and would love for you to sample their award winning selection.

Name: Hermitage Lodge
Description:
Overview

Hermitage Lodge is a multi award winning boutique hotel nestled on 10 hectares in the very heart of Hunter Valley wine country. Guests of Hermitage Lodge have easy access to many of the areas major attractions including cellar doors, golf courses and Hunter Valley Gardens. Numerous cellar doors are within easy walking distance including First Creek Wines, Scarborough, Constable Estate, Vinden Estate, Roche Wines and Brokenwood. Two championship golf courses, Cypress Lakes and The Vintage, are within a five minute drive of Hermitage Lodge while four other courses are less than twenty minutes away. Three concert venues, i.e. Hope Estate, Bimbadgen and Roche Wines are all within five minutes. It just doesn't get any better than Hermitage Lodge for location in Hunter Valley wine country.
Short Description: One of the Hunter Valleys premiere destinations. Encompassing world class accommodation with a Northern-Italian inspired restaurant, you'll experience the best the Hunter Valley has to offer.

Name: Hunaman
Description:
History

Following on from the success of renowned Melbourne restaurants Monsoon, Shakahari and Isthmus of Kra Jimmy Shu and his team decided to establish an iconic Asian restaurant in Darwin and Alice Springs. With chefs brought to our shores from Malaysia, Sri Lanka, Singapore, India, Indonesia Jimmy has built a reputation for consistently delighting guests with authentic Asian flavours.

THE HANUMAN STORY

Jimmy Shu grew up in Sri Lanka. The only son of a renowned restaurateur, Jimmy developed a love of food, of delighting guests and consistently innovating delicious dishes. Hanuman represents a lifelong commitment to creating exceptional Asian cuisine.

The result of a family passion turned into a career.

It only took one trip to Darwin, in search of fresh barramundi for his customers in Melbourne, to convince Jimmy Shu to sell up his Melbourne based restaurant empire and move North. His imagination had been captured by the delicious array of South-East Asian fruits, herbs and vegetables flourishing in the tropical climate. Since then Jimm has championed the development of local Asian market gardens, showcasing them in his Northern Territory and Cairns restaurants including the now famous Hanuman restaurant in Darwin which opened in 1992.
Short Description: One of Darwin's premiere restaurants with a reputation for consistently delighting guests with authentic Asian Flavours.

Name: Hunter Valley Resort
Description:
Welcome to the Hunter Valley Resort

Located in the very heart of the Hunter Valley Wine Country, the Hunter Valley Resort is an easy 2 hours motorway drive north of Sydney. Alternatively, come by train and we will pick you up from the local Singleton railway station.

We are not one of those 'big' international chain resorts, rather a family owned and operated country inn or lodge with 35 rooms and cottages, nestled within our own 45 year old shiraz vineyards on 70 secluded acres.

More than just a place to stay, onsite are many activities and facilities:
Short Description: Hunter Valley Resort, a family owned and operated resort in the heart of the Hunter Valley.

Name: Il Lido Bar Pizza
Description:
il lido barpizza

Situated at the Darwin Waterfront, right on the water’s edge, il lido barpizza is the ultimate place to relax in resort style comfort. Dishing up mouth-watering pizzas, burgers, nightly specials matched with an extensive beverage list. Drop in for a drink, enjoy the casual dining, relax with a cocktail and friend or get the whole crew together and party until the wee hours of the morning.

To get in touch, jump on the Il Lido Bar Pizza website and follow the links.

Short Description: Situated at the Darwin Waterfront, right on the water’s edge, il lido barpizza is the ultimate place to relax in resort style comfort.

Name: Jimmy Grants
Description:
When he arrived his name wasn’t Jimmy Grant, but whatever it was is now lost & forgotten.

Jimmy remembered the best souvlaki recipes from the old country, though, then added little touches from the new. Succulent, delicately spiced meats. Fresh salads & conversation-stopping sides. Something sweet for dessert.

Everyone’s happy. Especially Jimmy.

Want to join the team? 

Are you interested in joining the Jimmy Grants Team? We're always on the lookout for experienced, passionate and energetic front of house and kitchen professionals, and if we don't have a role that suits your skills right now we'll keep your details on file for future opportunities. Working at Jimmy Grants demands your very best, and in return you'll enjoy a fun, fast working environment with great people, as well as a host of benefits and career progression opportunities. Sound good? Then please email us with your CV and a cover letter telling us why you're the perfect fit for Jimmy Grants:

Email: recruitment@jimmygrants.com.au
Short Description: Delicious Greek dishes whipped up in a cool, casual cafe just off Fitzroy's bustling Smith Street. Adorned with ship and airplane murals on exposed brick walls.

Name: Kaesler Wines
Description:
The Kaesler family were pioneers who settled in the Barossa Valley in the 1840s. In 1891 they bought a parcel of land and in 1893 planted their first vines.

Today, Kaesler Wines are made from these ancient, dry grown vineyards by the third owners of this magnificent property.

We welcome you to our Barossa Valley Winery and Cellar Door; home of The Old Bastard, Alte Reben Shiraz, The Bogan and our other estate grown premium wines.
Short Description: One of the Barossa Valley oldest and most respected wineries. Established in 1893, today Kaeslar produced some of South Australia's best wines.

Name: Kosaten
Description:
Kosaten

Here at Kosaten, you’re in charge. All the delicious Japanese food and drinks at your fingertips. Literally, order to your heart’s content on our iPads and watch your food arrive on your own mini bullet train.Alone? No problem. We have spots for those flying solo.Got friends? Perfect. We have plenty of cosy booths here.Super popular? Go you! We have a function room for groups of 12 peoples upwards. Lunch and dinner, casual and fancy, cheap and quick (in a good way).
Short Description: Here at Kosaten, you’re in charge! Lunch and dinner, casual and fancy, cheap and quick (in a good way). Come by and see for yourself.

Name: Ladro
Description:
Ladro is Italian cuisine at it's finest. With two stores in the North and South of Melbourne, you'll find a buzzing, sleek restaurant serving incredible wood-fired pizzas and great wine.

Like what we do at Ladro?

Want to join us on the floor or in the kitchen?

We are always interested in talking to dedicated people with a passion for great food and service…and if you have the passion but not the experience, we will even train the right person. Get in touch via the employee form here
Short Description: Locally sourced Italian cuisine in a buzzing, sleek restaurant with a wood-fired oven and courtyard.
Employer email address: See employer description for contact details

Name: Landscape Restaurant and Grill
Description:
Inspired by the island

Landscape Restaurant & Grill creates unforgettable dining experiences in the heart of Hobart’s Hunter Street waterfront precinct. Our love for the exquisite produce of our island home has inspired our goal: to constantly push the benchmark for premium dining in Tasmania. Adding to the unique quality of our dishes is the unrivalled environment in which they’re served – the historic walls of the IXL jam factory, surrounded by the iconic art of John Glover.

Land, water and colour

Much of the inspiration for Landscape came from the artworks of John Glover – striking, unforgettable paintings that capture the life and beauty of the young Tasmanian colony in the 19th century. Today the John Glover Prize is an annual award that celebrates contemporary landscape paintings, and a selection of these prize-winning artworks are installed in the Private Dining Room in Landscape.

‍

‍
Short Description: Landscape Restaurant & Grill creates unforgettable dining experiences in the heart of Hobart’s Hunter Street waterfront precinct.

Name: Leeuwin Estate
Description: Family owned, Leeuwin Estate, one of the five founding wineries of the now famous Margaret River district of Western Australia, is under the direction of two generations who work with a team of highly skilled winemakers to consistently produce wines ranking alongside the world's finest. In 1972, legendary Napa Valley winemaker, Robert Mondavi, identified the future site of the Leeuwin vineyard as being ideal for the production of premium wine and provided early mentorship to Denis and Tricia Horgan in the transformation of their cattle farm into Leeuwin Estate. Enjoying its first commercial vintage in 1979, Leeuwin was thrust into the international spotlight when Decanter Magazine gave its highest recommendation to the 1980 "Art Series" Chardonnay. The international accolades have continued and Leeuwin now exports to 30 markets. Celebrating the combination of fine wine, food, art and music, Leeuwin features an award winning restaurant, cellardoor and art gallery. The Estate is renowned for staging spectacular events and welcoming visitors from around the world.
Short Description: Family owned, Leeuwin Estate is one of the five founding wineries of the now famous Margaret River district of Western Australia. The Estate is renowned for staging spectacular events and welcoming visitors from around the world.

Name: Lindenderry
Description:
About Lindenderry

It is better to travel well than to arrive. - Buddha

Our collection of award winning boutique hotels are as individual as you are. We understand the reason you travel is for unique, tailor-made experiences which are in tune with your needs, so when you stay with us it's hard not to feel special.

From our genuine service to our informal professionalism; our timeless designs and spectacular locations to our mouth-watering food and wine, we strive to get the little things right and to appreciate that your time is the ultimate luxury.

Weddings at Lindenderry

From a picture perfect location for your ceremony and photos to a gorgeous reception venue bursting with happiness, everything is one place – including a luxuriously appointed bridal suite and guest rooms for all. Topped off by ethereal Day Spas or private areas to help make you feel as beautiful as you will look, few wedding venues can offer as unique a combination as you and your groom.
Short Description: From a picture perfect location for your ceremony and photos to a gorgeous reception venue bursting with happiness. Red Hill's premiere wedding and function venue, offering beautiful accommodation and grounds for your all occasions.

Name: Long Chim
Description:
“At Long Chim you’ll find what is almost certainly the best Thai food Perth has ever seen. Possibly Australia. And certainly better food than most of what I ate in Thailand for three weeks last year. It’s all to do with self-confessed “aged wok jockey” David Thompson: the Sydney-raised, Bangkok-domiciled chef who has made a career for himself as a scholar of Thai cuisine” –  The Australian

Long Chim means to come and taste and our menus propose just that: a balanced and generous selection of the best dishes we can cook.

The Thai inspired cocktail menu is courtesy of the team from Singapore’s famously discreet 28 Hong Kong street under the expert hand of our own James Connolly and his team

Ask and imbibe on our unique selection of craft beers, eclectic mix of regional and global wines and signature cocktails to complement our menu.
Short Description: Long Chim means to come and taste and our menus propose just that: a balanced and generous selection of the best dishes we can cook. Come and experience it for yourself!
Address - street: Corner St Georges Terrace & Barrack St Perth

Name: Lou Miranda Estate
Description:
Our menu reflects the seasons with its modern interpretation of classic Italian cuisine. The aroma of fresh ingredients from the Winery garden greets you as you enter Cellar Door. Local produce also features in our chef’s delectable dishes. We offer daily Chef's suggestions, 'Wine and Food of the Month' and Luigi's Long Lunch, come in and ask us what we have available on the day as this changes with the seasonal produce when it becomes available.

You, your family and friends will be greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere. Relax in a tranquil setting while enjoying a delicious luncheon experience.

Please enquire today about our group bookings for lunch. Whether celebrating a work or family function, we have facilities that cater for up to 50 people or 20 people in a private room.

At Lou Miranda Estate, we endeavour to make every function a special occasion, please note for groups of 11 people or more we have a minimum requirement of 3 courses, please contact us today to discuss your function needs.

Our restaurant is only opened for lunch, however we do offer private evening functions, please contact us for more information on evening functions.
Short Description: At Lou Miranda Estate you'll find a warm and inviting atmosphere, and a modern interpretation of classic Italian cuisine.

Name: Meletos
Description:
About an hour north-east of Melbourne lies a region known as The Yarra Valley.

Here we make some of the world's most celebrated wine in one of the most picturesque locations in Australia. Our farmers growsuperb produce, and the blue-tinged mountains that surround our vineyards and orchards contain mountain ash forests thatpre-date European settlement.

In the heart of the Yarra Valley between the hamlets of Yarra Glen and Healesville lies a quiet country road called St Huberts,and if you take a turn at number 12 you'll discover one of the region's most exciting destinations.
Short Description: In the heart of the Yarra Valley between the hamlets of Yarra Glen and Healesville lies a quiet country road called St Huberts,and if you take a turn at number 12 you'll discover one of the region's most exciting destinations.

Name: Montalto
Description:
We want everyone who visits to feel rewarded for the time shared. This philosophy extends to everything we do. A warm welcome. Finely crafted wine. Food that feeds the senses and the soul. Our chef’s hat rated restaurant. A beautiful and bountiful property growing grapes, olives, fresh produce. A diverse and engaging setting for sculpture. We hope you love our little piece of paradise as much as we do. Offering sophisticated and romantic weddings, Montalto has become on of the Mornington Peninsula's premiere wedding and function venues.

‍
Short Description: One of the Mornington Peninsula's premiere food and wine destinations, offering sophisticated weddings and functions in beautiful surrounds.

Name: Mount Lofty House
Description:
The heritage design of Mount Lofty House perfectly captures the distinctive ambience of the breathtaking Piccadilly Valley and surrounding hills, which has lent its reputation as the pinnacle of luxury Adelaide Hills accommodation.

We are proud to be one of South Australia's best wedding destination venues, ideally situated in the Adelaide Hills, offering highly personalised and tailored wedding reception solutions.

The magnificent Adelaide surroundings of Mount Lofty House provide breathtaking views from our wedding locations while providing you with the best service and facilities on

your special day.
Short Description: Mount Lofty House is proudly one of South Australia's best wedding destination venues, ideally situated in the Adelaide Hills, offering highly personalised and tailored wedding reception solutions.

Name: Mudbar and Restaurant
Description:
History

Don and Mel Cameron have created four great restaurants in Tasmania. Mel’s gracious service and Don’s food became legendary. They have earned a huge following from loyal customers and the many staff they have trained over the years, most of whom know of the void that was created by the loss of Mel in 2015. Her handbook, Mel’s Way, sets the standard our staff continue to uphold to ensure our diners have the best time at Mudbar.

Join our great team

If you seek a fantastic job in a great workplace then Mudbar should be in your sights!

Mudbar has brought together a great team of young vibrant people who are motivated to be the best in providing high standard service every day in every way.

If you are a motivated self-starter then your resume should be sent to office@mudbar.com.au now. Over award pay and real rewards start here.
Short Description: Don and Mel Cameron have created four great restaurants in Tasmania. If you seek a fantastic job in a great workplace then Mudbar should be in your sights!

Name: Muse Dining
Description:
Located at the entrance to Pokolbin in the iconic Hungerford Hill Winery, Muse Restaurant is the creation of Husband and Wife team Troy and Megan Rhoades-Brown.

Troy and Megan opened Muse with the aim to offer a complete dining experience. With Troy applying his creativity in the kitchen and Megan her expertise in leading the front of house, Muse soon become renowned for not only its food but also for its professional and friendly service.

Offering a season driven Contemporary Australian menu, the food is fresh and exciting without overcomplicating the ingredients. Using quality produce, sourcing locally whenever possible, the dishes show technique, restraint and respect.

Employment

We are always looking for dedicated professionals to join our team. Please follow the link to our employment page here
Short Description: Soaring space with a large fireplace, for Modern Australian dishes with a local and seasonal focus in the heart of the Hunter Valley
Employer email address: See employer description for contact details

Name: Naked For Satan
Description:
Naked for Satan emulates a typical Basque bar, you can have a bite to eat whilst you enjoy a glass of wine. These bites are known as Pintxos (pronounced Pinchos), typically finger food eaten in two or three bites. There is seafood, fish, vegetarian, vegan, duck, chicken, meat, and of course, jamon. Everyone is catered for. Each one is designed to pair well with your choice of boutique beers (which are exclusively brewed for us), cider, wine or even our house infused vodka!

You walk through the door, and can’t take your eyes off the old vodka still that dominates the centre of the room. It’s as if you have stepped back into time or a movie set…… where am I? The expansive marble bar overflows with a beautiful array of Pintxos. Each one calling out, “pick me, pick me!”

Naked for Satan opened in August 2010, and within 6 months was awarded Cheap Eats Best Bar of the Year.
Short Description: Naked for Satan emulates a typical Basque bar located in the heart of Fitzroy. A place you can have a bite to eat whilst you enjoy a glass of wine.

Name: Oakridge
Description:
ABOUT US

Welcome to Oakridge, a family-owned, Yarra Valley winery, restaurant and cellar door, originally established in 1978 alongside a ridge of oak trees.

Pioneering the wine growing region of the upper Yarra Valley, today Oakridge is an award winning winery and an internationally recognised name. Oakridge wines can be found on restaurant menus, in bottle shops and for purchase online, but there is no better place to taste than at our home in the heart of the Yarra Valley; an hour’s drive from Melbourne, in Coldstream off the Maroondah Highway.
Short Description: Welcome to Oakridge, a family-owned, Yarra Valley winery, restaurant and cellar door, originally established in 1978 alongside a ridge of oak trees.

Name: Overlanders Steakhouse
Description:
G'day!

Welcome to the famous 'Overlanders Steakhouse' here in Alice Springs in the 'heart of Australia'.

Nestled amongst the stunningly beautiful MacDonnell Ranges, this wonderful historic town is the home of many attractions including the Royal Flying Doctor Service, the School of the Air and the world renowned Desert Park. 'The Alice' is acknowledged also as the centre for authentic Aboriginal art and culture, and features a wide variety of specialised authentic galleries. Take a tour of the Overlanders Steakhouse!

Cheers,

Mark, Jen and Krafty
Short Description: Welcome to the famous 'Overlanders Steakhouse' here in Alice Springs in the 'heart of Australia'.

Name: Peacock and Jones
Description:
A Hidden Harvest

Tucked away in an old sandstone warehouse on Hobart’s iconic waterfront, Peacock and Jones is a hidden gem that celebrates the beauty of Tasmanian food.

If you’re passionate about local produce, give us a visit; from your prime position in the open kitchen you’ll see your food as it’s sliced, smell it as it’s seasoned and hear it as it sizzles.

Our menu is constantly changing, because our dishes are driven by what Tasmania grows.

Much of the inspiration behind Peacock and Jones comes from its location: the sandstone warehouses of Hunter Street, a place steeped in colonial history. The warm and welcoming nature of the building allows us to bring our open kitchen concept to life, as our passionate staff help you experience the joys of fine wine and Tasmanian produce in a truly Tasmanian location.
Short Description: Tucked away in an old sandstone warehouse on Hobart’s iconic waterfront, Peacock and Jones is a hidden gem that celebrates the beauty of Tasmanian food.

Name: Public Dining Room
Description:
Public Dining Rooms unique waterfront position on Balmoral beach, allows you to take full advantage of its stunning location, on one of Sydney’s most exclusive beaches.   Balmoral beach is located on Middle Harbour in the harbourside suburb of Mosman, with views across to North Head and Manly, providing an ever changing backdrop for all occasions.

Public Dining Room has been designed to create a Scandinavian inspired look, with the modern and stylish yet relaxed space featuring raw and natural materials that complement the beachside location.

Weddings

Public Dining Room is the ideal setting for Balmoral Weddings. The restaurant offers uninterrupted views across Middle Harbour towards North Head and Manly and encompasses the very best of Sydney’s iconic beach culture.   Architecturally designed to be in harmony with it’s breathtaking environment, the space offers a relaxed yet elegant atmosphere both indoors and under the dappled light of the spectacular Moreton Bay Fig Tree on our adjoining outdoor terrace.
Short Description: With a beautifully designed Scandinavian look, Public Dining Room offers incredible food, wine and events on the shore of one of Sydney's most exclusive beaches.

Name: Reef Restaurant
Description:
Welcome to Reef

With the Central Coast’s most exclusive waterfront views, an amazingly passionate team, and delicious meals designed to bring the best from each season by our head chef Paul Bouwhuis, the Reef experience is unlike any other. Situated literally on the waters edge at the Haven, Terrigal, only a one hour drive from Sydney, Reef enjoys a stunning north easterly aspect with floor-to-ceiling glass and beachwood timber flooring.

The unique elegance of the Reef is unmatched on the Coast with our ability to cater for up to 160 guests. Our space was perfectly created for weddings, special events or functions of all types and sizes. From á la Carte or Degustation, to Tastings and Canapé style menus, our team is available to help you achieve the best outcome for your desired event.
Short Description: One of the Northern Rivers premiere food and events destinations, hosting private functions, weddings and restaurant service.

Name: Restaurant Tasman
Description:
Restaurant Tasman

At Restaurant Tasman we take our food seriously but we try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are a restaurant in a Hotel but that’s where the similarities end. Relaxed dining where we let the food and our friendly service speak for itself.

Our menu offers modern and contemporary food using the best local produce we can find. We feature some old favourites and some new, all with a distinctly Tasmanian twist.

Tasmania’s famous seafood, local free range meats, seasonal vegetables and char-grilled steaks along with local beers, ciders and a wide selection of our famous cool climate wines are on offer.
Short Description: At Restaurant Tasman we take our food seriously but we try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are a restaurant in a Hotel but that’s where the similarities end. Relaxed dining where we let the food and our friendly service speak for itself.

Name: Ripponlea Estate
Description:
About Us

National Heritage listed, Rippon Lea House and Garden is one of Australia’s grand suburban estates with a pleasure garden of sweeping lawns, magnificent trees and a tranquil lake. Located only ten kilometres from Melbourne this venue offers a sublime setting close to the CBD.

This classic venue is home to picturesque gardens including an ornamental lake, orchard, fernery and sweeping lawns where elegance and magnificence combine creating the perfect surroundings for your special occasion.

With a magnificent ballroom leading out onto an impressive pool and over 14 acres of pleasure gardens, Rippon Lea House & Gardens is the perfect venue for your next function. The many parts of the grounds can be used for garden wedding ceremonies, birthday parties and picnics, family gathering or Christmas break-ups. The Ballroom is an impressive venue for wedding receptions or corporate entertaining and gala dinners.

Weddings and Corporate Events

Rippon Lea House & Gardens is pleased to offer 14 acres of beautiful picturesque gardens for intimate wedding ceremonies through to grander events for more than 200 people. There are a variety of remarkable locations in the gardens that can be chosen for your special day, each offering you a unique and romantic setting.

Rippon Lea also offers a remarkable backdrop for a variety of functions:

– Wedding ceremonies

– Receptions

– Corporate gala dinners

– Private birthday parties

– Corporate family fun days

– Photography

– Garden parties
Short Description: A beautiful Victorian mansion set in 14 acres of garden. The Ballroom at Rippon Lea is an impressive venue for wedding receptions or corporate entertaining.

Name: Sake Restaurant
Description:
WORK AT SAKÉ

At Rockpool Dining Group we offer the best hospitality jobs and experience in Australia.

We believe it’s the people who make our venues. The people who share the passion, the attitude and the commitment for creating memorable dining experiences. The ones who work hard and have fun while they’re at it – those are our ROCKSTARS!

Sound like you? Then come in and say hi!

In return, we will give you the skills, training and mentorship from the best in the hospitality industry to help you build the career you’ve always wanted. With 50 (and counting) venues across the country, you really have room to grow with us.

Explore career opportunities here
Short Description: Treat yourself to a dynamic culinary experience straight from Saké’s top Executive Chefs who bring the dynamic and innovative Japanese culture to life through their mouthwatering creations
Employer email address: See venue description for contact details

Name: Small Fry
Description:
Welcome

Small-fry is a bar and kitchen in Hobart, Tasmania.

Join us for breakfast and lunch, a decadent sweet treat, a craft beer or a wine from our expertly crafted list. Join us for a lazy afternoon grazing through our varied, seasonal, menu, or for a coffee and snack on your way to work. Join us for a private dinner party for you and your guests.

Our open kitchen and casual but refined food creates a fresh and relaxed atmosphere, where you can interact with our kitchen staff while they cook your food, or just sit back and enjoy the ambience.

We want you to feel at home at Small-fry, and look forward to seeing you soon.
Short Description: Small-fry is a bar and kitchen in Hobart, Tasmania offering casual but refined food in a relaxed atmosphere.

Name: Smolt Restaurant
Description:
At Smolt Restaurant ingredients are sourced from local vegetable growers, farmers and cheese makers with whom we have built strong relationships and genuine partnerships. Our dishes reflect the season and support sustainable, ethical animal husbandry and fishing practices, using free range-chicken and grass-fed, ideally home-produced, beef, lamb, venison and the freshest seafood available.

JOB OPPORTUNITIES

Interested in coming onboard Hobart Restaurant Group’s renowned hospitality ‘fleet’? If so, we wholeheartedly welcome serious, informed enquiries from all comers – from top notch hospitality professionals to self-supporting students. Please complete the form below and provide any other relevant supporting information via this site and our dedicated HR coordinator, Angie, will respond to you personally if a suitable position is available and explore whether a place on our ‘deck’ meets your needs as well as ours.

If you are not already familiar with the three venues in the group, we strongly suggest you visit them all, either in person or on a website tour, as each offers a unique ‘flavour’ and different employment opportunities. The HRG fleet is headed by our flagship – Smolt Restaurant in Salamanca Square; the ‘pirate galleon’ – Frank Restaurant and Bar on Mawson’s Place puffs her sails with gusto; and Smolt Kitchen, our jaunty ‘day sailer’ on Hill Street, West Hobart, offers a calmer family-friendly outing.

We seek much more than ‘two hands and a heartbeat’ – and we will give back much more than a pat on the back and a pay slip. Our new ‘crew members’ receive formal induction and mentoring which eases them into an inclusive workplace community with a strong commitment to a shared ‘Service Goal’ of Excellence.

To achieve this we all commit to: ‘…working cooperatively to ensure the highest possible performance standards and sharing the responsibility of ensuring that every customer is attended to in a respectful, courteous and efficient manner.’

This goal is underpinned by our core values:• Respect – for one another, our customers and the raw materials we use each day• Inclusion – through flexibility, welcoming diversity in our work mates and our customers• Camaraderie – recognising our need for mutual support and having fun together• Passion – bringing energy, enthusiasm and gratitude to our work• Integrity – being true to ourselves, and having courage to express our uniqueness, and• Pride – in doing the best we can, in the beauty and produce of our state, in ourselves and in being part of this particular workplace.

Finally, whether we have an ‘advertised position’ or not, we are always keen to receive ‘Expressions of Interest’ from people with passion and personality.

We will do all we can to offer a supported career pathway if that is what you aspire to, a regular family-friendly slot a couple of days each week, or a bunch of shifts over peak periods when weddings or festivals crowd the off-site functions calendar.
Short Description: Mediterranean dining, local seafood: At Smolt Restaurant ingredients are sourced from local vegetable growers, farmers and cheese makers with whom we have built strong relationships and genuine partnerships. Our dishes reflect the season and support sustainable, ethical animal husbandry and fishing practices.

Name: Sosta Argentinian
Description:
WELCOME

SOSTA Argentinian Kitchen is a one of a kind Argentinian restaurant. With its fresh, contemporary take on Argentinian cuisine. Created in 2004, Sosta has quickly established itself as one of Adelaide’s premier food venues.

Set in the east end of Adelaide, Sosta space is warm and inviting with red brick walls, dark floating floors, and the aroma of the kitchen hard at work.

Using the best of local produce the menu has been kept simple to replicate the cooking of any home in Argentina.
Short Description: SOSTA Argentinian Kitchen is a one of a kind Argentinian restaurant. With its fresh, contemporary take on Argentinian cuisine. Created in 2004, Sosta has quickly established itself as one of Adelaide’s premier food venues.

Name: Spicers Retreat
Description:
HOME AMONGST THE VINEYARDS - HUNTER VALLEY NSW

Picture a luxuriously appointed estate set amongst rolling vineyards and native bushland just two hours’ drive from Sydney. A place where great food and wine provide the perfect recipe for relaxation. Where Spa Anise adds to the feeling of rejuvenation and revitalisation. And where appreciating life comes as naturally as appreciating the latest vintage.
Short Description: From world-class cuisine to rejuvenating day spas, romantic getaways to spectacular wedding venues, unforgettable events to breathtaking surroundings, Spicers Retreats invite you to experience the true meaning of relaxed luxury.

Name: St Crispin
Description:
Located in the heart of Collingwood, Saint Crispin’s kitchen, run by chefs Scott Pickett and Chris Haydon, prepares a finely considered contemporary menu that’s amended daily according to nature’s bounty.

The dining room bar serves equally mulled over cocktails, wines, ales and champagnes. We also boast a couple of beautifully furnished private dining rooms upstairs, perfect for any occasion.

Saint Crispin is Scott Pickett’s second restaurant.

Scott has cooked in restaurants such as Paul Bocuse, with Philippe Mouchel and The Square in London. As well as Saint Crispin, Scott owns Northcote’s two-hatted Estelle by Scott Pickett (ESP) and Estelle Bistro. His most recent offering is Pickett’s Deli & Rotisserie at Melbourne’s iconic The Queen Victoria Market.

Scott and Saint Crispin’s Head Chef Chris Haydon share a vision to deliver contemporary and inspiring cuisine that’s accessible and affordable.

CAREERS

We are always interested in hearing from like-minded people – if you are interested in joining the team in the kitchen or front of house, please email your inquiry and CV to us.
Short Description: Located in the heart of Collingwood, Saint Crispin’s kitchen, run by chefs Scott Pickett and Chris Haydon, prepares a finely considered contemporary menu that’s amended daily according to nature’s bounty.

Name: Stillwater
Description:
Contemporary Tasmanian Cuisine - Elegant Casual Dining.

‍
Short Description: One of Launceston's most respected restaurants offering incredible food and wine

Name: Stokehouse Q
Description:
STOKE RESTAURANT

Stokehouse Q embodies ‘relaxed elegance’, thanks to the up-market dining style that is complemented by youthful, attentive and knowledgeable service. The menu is inspired by flavours from the Mediterranean and greater Europe, cued by the freshest local produce, curated by some of Australia’s most talented young chefs. The experience is made complete by the restaurant itself, Brisbane’s most photogenic venue, and the unsurpassed river and city views.

STOKE BAR

Gazing straight down the Brisbane River, with a backdrop of the city skyline, a seat at the Stoke Bar is truly like no other. Join us for a light lunch by the glistening water, plan an indulgent evening of champagne and oysters by the bright city lights, or chill out at our next Sunday session with DJs, expertly made cocktails and delicious snacks.
Short Description: Stokehouse Q embodies ‘relaxed elegance’, thanks to the up-market dining style that is complemented by youthful, attentive and knowledgeable service.

Name: Stones of the Yarra Valley
Description:
Rising from the rustic, weather-beaten remnants of a barn left idle for generations,Stones of the Yarra Valley has emerged as the region’s premiere food and wine destination.

With uninterrupted views across vines to the blue-tinged Great Divide, Stones of the Yarra Valley is located on one of the most picturesque and historic properties in the Yarra Valley, combining two superb restaurants – The Barn and The Stables at Stones –with a stunning rough-rendered Chapel and Dairy nestled under century-old oak trees.
Short Description: Located on one of the most picturesque and historic properties in the Yarra Valley, combining two superb restaurants – The Barn and The Stables at Stones –with a stunning rough-rendered Chapel and Dairy nestled under century-old oak trees.

Name: Stumpy Gully Winery
Description:
Start your Mornington Peninsula wine adventure with us

Just 50 minutes from Melbourne and first stop off the Peninsula Link freeway at Moorooduc you’ll find Stumpy Gully Vineyard.

The Zantvoort family planted its first vines here in 1989. While many other wineries in the region have since been bought out by larger companies, the Zantvoorts have kept it in the family.

They believe that doing things their way makes for more memorable wines. Wines with a story. Good value wines that friends ask about when you open a bottle or two at dinner or a BBQ. And wines – they don’t mind saying – that win awards.

Drop in and say hello at Stumpy Gully this weekend.

Want to get in touch? Follow the link here
Short Description: In the Moorooduc heart of the Mornington Peninsula wine-touring region, just under one hour's drive south of the Melbourne CBD, you'll find Stumpy Gully. One of the Mornington Peninsula's premiere food and wine destinations!

Name: Swings and Roundabouts
Description:
The views over our vineyards provide a stunning backdrop for whatever the occasion, be it a birthday party, family reunion or a corporate get together. Our venue is suitable for both large cocktail style events and sit down dinners. Our verandah & gallery area’s provide the perfect space for long table lunches or of course feel free to use our back lawn, you can hire a marquee or sit under the stars.

"Intimate, bespoke weddings"

DAY OR NIGHT, RAIN OR SHINE

Rustic, Romantic and Relaxed. We offer bespoke intimate weddings with an emphasis on quality, local produce, exceptional service and great wines all set to a beautiful natural backdrop of rolling vineyards perfectly serving as the canvas for your special day. Our dedicated Wedding coordinator and kitchen team strive to create unique occasions through detailed planning and consultation delivering your day your way.
Short Description: Rustic, Romantic and Relaxed. We offer bespoke intimate weddings with an emphasis on quality, local produce, exceptional service and great wines all set to a beautiful natural backdrop of rolling vineyards.

Name: The Boat House
Description:
Weddings at the Boat House

Offering a unique opportunity to host a truly exceptional wedding reception, the Boat House was recently announced the Best Wedding Venue in the ACT in the Restaurant and Catering Awards.You can rest assured knowing your special day will be the best it can be.In an enchanting atmosphere situated in its own private parklands, The Boat House boasts absolute waterfront views of the lake. Watch the beautiful sunset over the lake as the day’s colourful palettes fade away to reveal the lights of the Kingston Foreshore dancing across the water.

Minutes from the city but miles from the world

Want to join the team? Follow the link to get in contact with us here
Short Description: Recently voted Best Wedding Venue in the ACT, The Boat House: minutes from the city, miles from the world.
Employer email address: See venue description for contact details

Name: The Boatshed
Description:
Renowned for its spectacular 180 degree views of the Swan River, Perth City and Kings Park, The Boatshed Restaurant was built in 1995 by owner Graeme Millar after realising the potential to deliver an exceptional dining experience at the iconic Coode Street location.

Designed to complement the natural surroundings of Sir James Mitchell Park with an elegant, warm and inviting interior, the restaurant maximises its unrivalled panoramic view with floor to ceiling glass windows.

Passionate determination and unwavering commitment to deliver the finest quality food and service for over two decades has allowed The Boatshed to become one of the most respected restaurants in Perth.
Short Description: Passionate determination and unwavering commitment to deliver the finest quality food and service for over two decades has allowed The Boatshed to become one of the most respected restaurants in Perth.

Name: The Brisbane Club
Description:
THE BRISBANE CLUB

About Us

The Brisbane Club is one of Brisbane's pioneer clubs established in 1903 and is situated in the heart of the CBD in a contemporary setting in the Brisbane Club Tower.

This setting typifies its unique niche in being a progressive contemporary club whilst being mindful of its traditional heritage. The Brisbane Club offers a home away from home and as such provides a refuge from the hustle and bustle in the midst of a modern, growing city.

Careers

At The Brisbane Club we are always seeking the very best talent. A cheerful, inspired and continually trained staff is our commitment to enhance the experience of our members and guests. It is our daily goal to ensure that the Club truly feels like a "home away from home".

If your passion and commitment is to deliver great customer service every day, we invite you to apply to be part of our team.

Submit your current resume to our HR Coordinator: careers@brisbaneclub.com.au

‍
Short Description: The Brisbane Club is one of Brisbane's pioneer clubs established in 1903. If your passion and commitment is to deliver great customer service every day, we invite you to apply to be part of our team.

Name: The Cellar Restaurant
Description:
Centrally located in the heart of Pokolbin, just a short stroll from the world class Hunter Valley Gardens and within easy access to wineries and golf clubs, The Cellar Restaurant offers rustic Mediterranean inspired cuisine in elegant yet relaxed surroundings.

Our wisteria surrounded courtyard is perfect for an alfresco lunch with large umbrellas for shade on the hotter days.

Our sandstone and glass building features lush indoor gardens intermingled with white clothed tables and a huge welcoming fireplace in the centre.  The ambience is sophisticated yet relaxed with welcoming staff and country-friendly service.  The restaurant is fully air conditioned during the warmer months and in winter, the cosy open fire and flickering candles impart warmth and elegance.

For contact details go here
Short Description: Centrally located in the heart of Pokolbin, just a short stroll from the world class Hunter Valley Gardens and within easy access to wineries and golf clubs, The Cellar Restaurant offers rustic Mediterranean inspired cuisine in elegant yet relaxed surroundings.

Name: The Deck at Regatta Point
Description:
About us

Overlooking Lake Burley Griffin and Commonwealth Park, The Deck at Regatta Point is Canberra’s most picturesque venue. It boasts Canberra’s most amazing views and comprises both an indoor and outdoor aspects, complimented by floor to ceiling glass that literally fills the venue with natural light. It‘s the perfect space for weddings and corporate events alike, with stunning lakeside sunsets creating the perfect backdrop.

The Deck offers modern surrounds and versatility when it comes to its capacity to handle all types of events and occasions. It is ideally suited to hosting weddings, birthday celebrations, corporate dinners and cocktail parties. The Deck is renowned for delivering personalised service, designing tailored events that always exceed client expectations and leave lasting memories
Short Description: Overlooking Lake Burley Griffin and Commonwealth Park, The Deck at Regatta Point is Canberra’s most picturesque venue.

Name: The Dolphin Hotel
Description:
The highly anticipated new look Dolphin Hotel has officially opened its doors to the Public Bar, Dining Room and Wine Room. Maurice Terzini and his team have built on the iconic venue’s heritage, adding an exciting new layer to its history by repurposing and transforming the space with a modern perspective and offering quality food and beverage.

Regarded for decades as a Surry Hills institution synonymous with good times, The Dolphin Hotel now features three distinct spaces, a Dining Room, Wine Room and a Public Bar with an open-air terrace.

‍

Want to join the team? Follow the link here
Short Description: Buzzing pub over 3 levels, with modern decor and an outdoor terrace, serving burgers and steaks.
Employer email address: info@dolphinhotel.com.au or via link in venue description

Name: The Drunken Admiral
Description:
About The Drunken Admiral

The Drunken Admiral has been operating as a family run restaurant since 1979. We provide the diner with a truly unique experience, offering the very freshest Tasmanian seafood and meals set amongst a vibrant maritime atmosphere.

Being one of Hobarts most iconic restaurants, we’re popular with both locals and tourists alike, so reservations are advised.
Short Description: The Drunken Admiral has been operating as a family run restaurant since 1979. We provide the diner with a truly unique experience, offering the very freshest Tasmanian seafood and meals set amongst a vibrant maritime atmosphere.

Name: The Farm - Byron Bay
Description:
GROW · FEED · EDUCATE

The Farm is principally a working farm, we house a collection of micro-businesses all sharing in a common goal. We invite you to come and visit us and see for yourself how a farm operates, supports the environment and contributes to a healthier lifestyle.

Our motto ‘Grow, Feed, Educate’ inspires all that we do, here and for the community at large. We believe that it is first hand experience of seeing how food is grown and produced that makes the eating of it so much more pleasurable. From this simple pleasure sprouts a curiosity and desire to learn more.

We hope you enjoy your visit to The Farm and leave feeling inspired to make even the smallest change towards a healthier, more harmonious existence with our land, our animals and our communities.

Want to get in touch? Follow the link and fill out our contact sheet here
Short Description: One of Byron Bays most renowned venues offering incredible food, as well as the opportunity to reconnect with the land.
Employer email address: See employer description for contact details

Name: The Grounds of Alexandria
Description:
ABOUT THE CAFE:

The Cafe is full of energy and life, created as an engaging and inspiring place for guests to reconnect with one another over world-class coffee and wholesome food.

The Cafe is home to an artisan Bakery & Patisserie where guests can experience an inside look, as they watch our bakers creating fresh-baked sourdough loaves and and our pastry chefs fashioning irresistible pastries before their very eyes.

ABOUT THE GARDEN:

The Grounds’ Garden is overflowing with an abundance of greenery and florals and is our largest event space consisting of three areas; the Gazebo, the Arbour and the Patio.

A crumbling brick wall covered with creeping vines and a generous scattering of fairy lights provides the perimeter for the Garden that offers both an urban sanctuary & a beautiful event space.

Adaptable to host a multitude of events from wedding celebrations to corporate parties, it is a vast space with the potential to be elegantly transformed in line with your creative vision.

The Garden includes an outdoor dance floor space, ceremony space and an alfresco bar.

The possibilities are endless, and we are here to help you develop, plan and put into place the perfect event for any occasion.

Want to get in contact? Follow the link here
Short Description: Homestyle food and specialty coffee in a former pie factory with brick walls and an organic garden.
Employer email address: See venue description for contact details

Name: The Old Brewery
Description:
Come and enjoy spectacular views as you indulge in WA’s best seasonal produce, the finest cuts of beef, lamb, pork, poultry and seafood prepared and cooked to perfection by our highly skilled chefs under the uncompromising direction of Executive Chef Greg Farnan. Big meat lovers find it hard to resist Greg’s legendary ‘Tomahawk Steak.’ This impressive 1.4-2.7kg organic Wagyu beef rib eye steak can be shared between two or more and is hand-carved by the Chef at your table.

This tranquil oasis, just minutes from the CBD, boasts spectacular 270 degree views of the Swan River, the Narrows Bridge, the City lights, South Perth foreshore and beyond. The hedged lawn rolling out from our alfresco dining area, almost to the water’s edge, is the perfect venue for couples to share their wedding vows before celebrating with a magnificent reception in our fabulous ‘Thomas Hardwick Function Room’.
Short Description: This tranquil oasis, just minutes from the CBD, boasts spectacular 270 degree views of the Swan River, the Narrows Bridge, the City lights, South Perth foreshore and beyond. Come and enjoy spectacular views as you indulge in Western Australia’s best seasonal produce, the finest cuts of beef, lamb, pork, poultry and seafood.

Name: The Paddington Hotel
Description: As Paddington is well in the midst of its renaissance, we are excited to be a part of the revival of a place we’ve called home for over 20 years. As this iconic suburb comes to life once more we’ll be adding our own flavour with an innovative wine list and cocktail menu with a twist.
Short Description: Experience Paddington's best bar and dining. Newly renovated, The Paddington Inn has a seasonal menu best shared, and a bar cocktail list you'll want to keep!
Address - street: 338 Oxford Street, (Cnr of Oxford and William St)

Name: The Partisan
Description:
We deliver local produce driven, stripped back European provincial dishes with our modern take on the cuisines of the southern European Mediterranean nations i.e. Spain, France & Italy the positive aspects being we are not tied to one particular food style, can draw on different inspirations in décor, food design ect… While still incorporating a cold larder driven side of the menu.

‍

If you would like to contact us, please use our online form here: http://thepartisan.com.au/contact/
Short Description: Experience the joy of riverside romantic breakfast, lunch or dinner at the Partisan. Enjoy the best of European cuisine and tapas, wines and beers.
Employer email address: See venue description for contact details

Name: The Pearl
Description: Modern Australian Bistro and Bar with a French twist. Dinner Tuesday to Saturday from 5.30pm. Friday lunch and Saturday champagne brunch from 10am.
Short Description: The Pearl is a modern Australian bistro and bar with a French twist, situated in the heart of Darwin.

Name: The Sicillian Restaurant
Description:
The Restaurant

The Sicilian revives the 1940s inspired Italian dining experience.We are very demanding when it comes to the things we put in our mouth.We don't settle for second best. It is nothing personal.It is just business. And good food is good business.We don't want to waste anybody's time because time is money. Pay us a visit and we'll make you an offer you can't refuse.

We are The Sicilian.
Short Description: A 1940's inspired Italian dining experience in the heart of Forster. We don't settle for second best, it's nothing personal.

Name: The Stables at Stones
Description:
The Stables at Stones is one of the Yarra Valley’s most celebrated food and wine destinations.

With its soaring red brick walls and rough-hewn timbers, throughout the late 1800′s this historic building served as the stablehand quarters of a bustling farming community called Castellaville.

After a remarkable conversion that would have impressed Kevin McCloud himself, The Stables now operate as an intimate restaurant space under the helm of Executive Chef Hugh Davison (London’s Kitchen w8, Flemings Mayfair & Marcus Wareing at the Berkeley). Presenting a regional tasting menu on Friday and Saturday evenings and a shared plate lunch on Saturdays and Sundays,Davison’s menus are crafted from scratch each week based on the seasonality and availability of local produce.
Short Description: The Stables at Stones is one of the Yarra Valley’s most celebrated food and wine destinations, offering a regional tasting menu Friday to Sunday evenings, and a shared plate lunch on Saturdays and Sundays.

Name: The Tilbury Hotel
Short Description: An innercity gastro based hotel heavily food focused. Catering to a corporate & young professional market during the week and families at the weekend.

Name: Three Blue Ducks
Description:
Three Blue Ducks is a small licensed restaurant located up the hill from Bronte Beach in Sydney. Owned by a friendly bunch of guys who take both food and fun seriously, Three Blue Ducks offers some of the best food in town.

Eating and drinking - Honest, innovative and local 

We source the best local produce to create unique dishes with bags of flavour – morning, noon and night. Many fresh ingredients come straight from our kitchen garden on-site. Our bar stocks quality boutique beers, ciders and wine. Plus the coffee is to die for. We use organic, Fairtrade, biodynamic and locally sourced products wherever we can. 

Visit us 

Three Blue Ducks is for lovers of good, honest and original food in a laid-back setting where service is king. Come on down and say hello, or book a table.

Jobs

We are always looking for talented people to work with us at the Three Blue Ducks. We are passionate about what we do and love to have fun at the same time - if that sounds like you too, give us a shout here
Short Description: Three Blue Ducks is a small licensed restaurant located up the hill from Bronte Beach in Sydney. Owned by a friendly bunch of guys who take both food and fun seriously, Three Blue Ducks offers some of the best food in town.
Employer email address: View venue description for contact details

Name: Twine Restaurant
Description:
About Twine.

Twine is the ultimate wedding and event venue. Overlooking the lazy Oakey Creek Valley with its rolling hills lined with vines.

Twine is the Hunter's iconic function venue to host your unique event; from private dinners served in our wine room, to hosting events and team building activities and of course wedding ceremonies and receptions.

We will be featuring wine maker’s dinner's monthly and don't forget our industry long lunches are an amazing way to spend a Monday.

Let our team create an event your guests will be raving about for years to come.

Follow the link for contact details here
Short Description: One of the Hunter Valleys iconic and premiere function venues, offering private dinners, events, functions and weddings.

Name: Voyager Estate
Description:
Explore wine and food in decadent surroundings

With wine at the centre of everything we do, we invite you to a different style of lunch dining. We offer two different wine-paired degustation menus, designed to showcase the best in wine and food matching, and carefully crafted with local, seasonal produce.

The 6-course Wine Discovery Menu is our signature experience; each course is a chapter of our wine story, from the vineyard to the table.

Our 4-course Discovery Menu showcases our beautiful Margaret River region, with three wine varietals that have put our region on the world winemaking map.

As this is a journey of discovery, we don’t publish our menus in advance. See below for some of the key produce you can expect, and our chefs will cater to most dietary requirements and food dislikes if you let us know in advance.

We look forward to welcoming you during your next visit to Margaret River. Contact us by email at restaurant@voyagerestate.com.au or by calling us +61 8 9757 6354.
Short Description: Located in the premium wine producing region of Margaret River, Voyager Estate offers incredible food and wine in decadent surroundings.

Name: Watershed
Description:
RESTAURANT & CAFÉ

Enjoy lunch and capture that Margaret River ambiance at Watershed’s restaurant and alfresco dining deck overlooking our rolling vineyard and dam. Our Ric Stein trained Head Chef Dan Gedge sources Margaret River’s freshest seasonal produce to create exquisite contemporary Australian dishes.  With great food complemented by an award-winning selection of premium wines, the Watershed restaurant should be on every food and wine lovers list.
Short Description: Enjoy lunch and capture that Margaret River ambiance at Watershed’s restaurant and alfresco dining deck overlooking our rolling vineyard and dam.
Address - street: Corner Bussell highway and Darch road

Name: Wharf One
Description:
Our Story

Welcome

Wharf One Food & Wine is the newest restaurant at the Darwin Waterfront, that opened on the 28 May 2015. Our restaurant’s industrial decor is chic and welcoming, and every table has spectacular water-views of the lagoon and the Darwin Harbour.  It’s hard to decide if you want to sit outside in the alfresco area that is undercover with fans or inside in the air-conditioning.

We work on making everything we do generous with robust flavours and our Chef’s draw on their diverse food experiences, use the best ingredients and local produce they can get their hands on. They will cook food you love to eat. Many of our dishes are prepared over our wood burning grill that infuses our food with a mouth-watering subtle smoke that enhances the flavour of everything.

Our chef-inspired dishes are made to order and prepared in our open-air kitchen, making you part of the culinary experience.

The food, wine, friendly service and atmosphere all combine to make it one of Darwin’s most enjoyable Dining experiences.  We invite you to experience Wharf One Food & Wine, where you can see and smell your food cooking.
Short Description: Combining industrial decor with spectacular water-views of Darwin Habour, Wharf One strikes the perfect balance between remarkable food and a relaxed atmosphere.

Name: Windy Point
Description:
Windy Point Restaurant and Cafe are situated just 15 minutes from the heart of the city.

Through full length 180° windows, guests enjoy breathtaking panoramic views, sweeping from St Vincent’s Gulf to the Adelaide Hills.

Our commitment is to complement the view with exemplary food and service
Short Description: At Windy Point you will not only find incredible food and wine, but breathtaking panoramic views overlooking St Vincent's Gulf and the Adelaide Hills.

Name: Woolwich Pier Hotel
Description:
The Woolwich Pier Hotel offers the perfect setting for every occasion.

Step out to The Terrace, The Lawn and The Clubhouse to enjoy casual celebrations in a sensational outdoor setting. Gather the girls for high tea or treat your friends and family to a gourmet barbecue on The Terrace. Also outside, you’ll find The Pavilions, which provide a great gathering point for groups of all sizes.

Inside you can soak up all the atmosphere of the stylish Dining Hall on the ground floor bistro area. Alternatively, head upstairs, grab yourself a spot on the Balcony and take in stunning views stretching over Cockatoo Island and the harbour. For the ultimate private dining experience, you can also book The Good Room and indulge in one of our lavish shared meal experiences accompanied by a bottle of best red.
Short Description: The Woolwich Pier Hotel is an upscale bistro serving mains and cheese boards in a bright, elegant pub with harbour views. Recently voted New South Wales best pub for 2014.

Name: Zafferano
Description:
Welcome to Zafferano Restaurant

Zafferano Restaurant is one of a select few of Perth’s finest riverside dining experiences….with the breathtaking views overlooking the Swan River ....come and see the best views that our beautiful City and Swan River has on offer……overlooking Canning Bridge, Crawley Bay and the majestic Perth City Skyline together they set the perfect atmosphere for any occasion with everyone on your table having a different breathtaking view. Open Seven days for Lunch and Dinner from 11am until late ….come in to see the views for yourself. Zafferano Restaurant seats 120 in winter and 160 in summer using our extensive outdoor terrace…by opening the glass doors we welcome in Perth’s warm summer days and balmy nights overlooking the majestic views in all directions of our beautiful Perth City and Swan River.
Short Description: Zafferano Restaurant in one of Perth's finest restaurants, offering a breathtaking view of the Swan River as well as sensational food and wine.

Name: Zonzo Estate
Description:
Zonzo Estate is a Yarra Valley restaurant, winery and award-winning wedding destination, boasting authentic Italian food. Open for lunch Wednesday to Sunday and dinner Friday to Sunday. Book in for some time out or try our debut vintage.

 

Zonzo Estate is a spectacular restaurant and events destination in the Yarra Valley where people come to escape city life. If you pride yourself on making others feel welcome and strive to exceed expectations, send us your resume here.
Short Description: Zonzo Estate is a spectacular restaurant and events destination in the Yarra Valley where people come to escape city life. If you pride yourself on making others feel welcome and strive to exceed expectations, then apply to become a part of the team!
